title: The Disappearance Ledger
outcome: Journals written by the returned disappeared reveal that Halden sabotaged his own system to save lives. Survivor-led forums and revelations about secret detainment fracture public trust in Council and BCI alike, pushing the city into open reckoning and radical demands for truth and accountability.

events.description: Journals from returned missing citizens are posted online and in communal spaces, detailed accounts of secret detainment and experimental rehabilitation under early BCI oversight.
Neighborhood forums spring up across the city, run by survivors, giving firsthand testimony of Halden's direct intervention to undermine Council orders and free detainees without authorization.
Council attempts to discredit the journals, but technical evidence from logs and past watchlists proves their authenticity. The city's outrage deepens and protests spread.

A coalition of survivor groups and allies demand open trials for BCI abuses, forcing the Council to confront a loss of moral authority as entire sectors threaten noncompliance until accountability is met.
